requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all data from backend APIs
user_persona: A local community researcher exploring neighborhood data.
user_goal: To load and view real-time neighborhood data through the frontend application.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Application
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the neighborhood mapping application in her browser expecting to see live data.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the application URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend loads successfully and begins fetching initial data from backend APIs.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Data Load
narrative_steps.description: She waits briefly as the app retrieves neighborhood boundaries and key metrics.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for data to populate the UI.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Map renders with neighborhood boundaries and dashboard sections display loading spinners before showing actual data.

requirement_tested: A backend application connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer verifying backend connectivity during deployment.
user_goal: To confirm that the backend service connects properly to the configured PostgreSQL instance.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Alex runs the backend service after setting up the correct environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server process.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend initializes successfully and logs connection confirmation to the PostgreSQL database using provided credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Database Query
narrative_steps.description: He sends a test request to retrieve neighborhood data.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/neighborhoods endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server responds with valid JSON data retrieved from the connected PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Interactive map display for visualizing neighborhood boundaries and selecting areas
user_persona: A city planner reviewing district boundaries.
user_goal: To explore neighborhood boundaries visually and select one for detailed inspection.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Initial Map State
narrative_steps.description: Maria sees the interactive map centered on the default location with neighborhood outlines visible.
narrative_steps.action: Load the map view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Map displays neighborhood boundaries styled with forest green strokes against an ivory background.

narrative_steps.title: Hovering Over Boundary
narrative_steps.description: She hovers her cursor over a neighborhood to preview its selection.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a neighborhood boundary.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Boundary temporarily highlights with a semi-transparent forest green overlay.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Neighborhood
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the choice, Maria clicks the boundary to inspect it further.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a neighborhood boundary.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Neighborhood fills with forest green, and a basic info panel appears below the map.

requirement_tested: Area comparison functionality allowing users to select multiple neighborhoods for side-by-side data analysis
user_persona: A policy analyst comparing urban development impacts across districts.
user_goal: To compare demographic profiles of three neighborhoods side by side.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Multiple Areas
narrative_steps.description: David clicks on three distinct neighborhoods he wants to compare.
narrative_steps.action: Click on three separate neighborhood boundaries.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each clicked neighborhood is highlighted, and corresponding chips appear in the floating control bar above the map.

narrative_steps.title: Activating Comparison Mode
narrative_steps.description: Now ready, David clicks the Compare button which has become enabled.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Compare' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Application navigates to the comparison dashboard populated with data from the selected neighborhoods.

requirement_tested: Demographic data visualization including population, age distribution, and household information
user_goal: To analyze differences in age distributions among selected neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Demographics Section
narrative_steps.description: Emily navigates to the demographic charts section of the dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Open the demographics tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Bar chart displaying total population per selected neighborhood is shown with forest green bars on ivory background.

narrative_steps.title: Switching to Age Distribution View
narrative_steps.description: Curious about ages, she switches to view median age data instead.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Median Age' tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart updates to show median age values for each selected neighborhood.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Specific Values
narrative_steps.description: Emily hovers over individual bars to get exact figures.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over chart elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltip appears showing precise numeric value for each hovered element.

requirement_tested: Economic data visualization covering income levels, employment rates, and housing costs
user_persona: An economist evaluating regional economic health.
user_goal: To examine unemployment trends in selected neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Economic Metrics
narrative_steps.description: James scrolls to the economic indicators section of the dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the economic data visualization area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Section shows KPI cards for each neighborhood featuring metrics like median income and unemployment rate.

narrative_steps.title: Expanding Trend Details
narrative_steps.description: Wanting more detail, James clicks on an unemployment card to see historical trends.
narrative_steps.action: Click on an unemployment metric card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Modal window opens displaying a line graph of unemployment trends over time.

requirement_tested: Crime statistics display with filtering options by crime type and time period
user_persona: A public safety officer assessing neighborhood risk factors.
user_goal: To review property crime incidents over the last six months.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Crime Filter Panel
narrative_steps.description: Officer Taylor locates the crime statistics section and opens the filter controls.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the crime statistics filter dropdowns.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dropdown menus for crime type and date range become accessible.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Filters
narrative_steps.description: Taylor selects 'Property' crime type and sets the date range to the past six months.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Property' from crime type dropdown and choose six-month date range.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Stacked bar chart redraws showing only property crimes within the selected timeframe.

narrative_steps.title: Analyzing Results
narrative_steps.description: He hovers over segments of the chart to understand monthly breakdowns.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over segments of the stacked bar chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Counts and percentages for each crime subcategory are displayed in a tooltip.

requirement_tested: Dashboard with interactive charts for all major data categories
user_persona: A data analyst building a comprehensive report.
user_goal: To review all major data types in one consolidated view.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Dashboard View
narrative_steps.description: Rachel accesses the main dashboard to see integrated visualizations.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Grid-based layout presents demographic, economic, and crime charts simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Charts
narrative_steps.description: She interacts with various chart elements to gain deeper insights.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over different chart points and bars.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Detailed tooltips provide precise data values for each interaction point.

requirement_tested: Customizable dashboard layout allowing users to arrange and resize chart widgets
user_persona: A researcher customizing their workspace for efficiency.
user_goal: To rearrange dashboard widgets to prioritize frequently used charts.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Edit Controls
narrative_steps.description: Dr. Lee notices drag handles on dashboard widgets indicating editability.
narrative_steps.action: Look for drag handles on chart widgets.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Visible drag handles indicate that widgets can be moved or resized.

narrative_steps.title: Repositioning Widget
narrative_steps.description: He drags the demographic chart to the top-left position for easy access.
narrative_steps.action: Drag the demographic chart widget to a new location.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Widget moves smoothly within the grid and snaps into place at the target position.

narrative_steps.title: Saving New Layout
narrative_steps.description: After organizing everything, Dr. Lee saves his preferred arrangement.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Save Layout' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New widget positions are persisted either locally or server-side depending on login status.

requirement_tested: Data filtering and sorting capabilities for all displayed information
user_goal: To find the most expensive neighborhoods based on median rent.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Sort Controls
narrative_steps.description: Reporter Kim finds the economic data table and looks for sorting options.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Median Rent' column header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Column enters ascending sort mode and dataset refreshes accordingly.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Descending Order
narrative_steps.description: Kim clicks again to reverse the sort direction and see highest rents first.
narrative_steps.action: Click the same column header again.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dataset now shows entries sorted by descending median rent values.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering by Range
narrative_steps.description: She applies additional filters to narrow down results to specific rent ranges.
narrative_steps.action: Click filter icon next to column header and enter min/max rent values.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only neighborhoods matching the rent criteria remain visible in the dataset.

requirement_tested: Responsive design compatible with desktop and tablet viewing
user_persona: A mobile field worker checking data remotely.
user_goal: To access the application effectively on a tablet device.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing on Tablet Screen
narrative_steps.description: Field agent Jordan opens the application on his tablet-sized screen.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to simulate tablet resolution (~1024px).
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout shifts automatically to adapt to tablet format with condensed navigation.

narrative_steps.title: Using Collapsed Navigation
narrative_steps.description: Jordan taps the hamburger menu to access hidden navigation links.
narrative_steps.action: Tap the hamburger-style navigation icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Slide-in navigation drawer appears revealing full menu options.

requirement_tested: Ivory background color (#FFFFF0) applied throughout the application
user_persona: A UX designer validating brand consistency.
user_goal: To verify consistent use of the ivory background theme.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Main Interface
narrative_steps.description: Designer Alex inspects the overall look of the application interface.
narrative_steps.action: Load any standard page of the application.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Body background color is consistently ivory (#FFFFF0) across all views.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Nested Elements
narrative_steps.description: Alex verifies nested containers maintain the same background tone.
narrative_steps.action: Examine inner panels and modals.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All enclosed areas retain the ivory background without unexpected color variations.

requirement_tested: Forest green color (#228B22) used for interactive components and highlights
user_persona: A front-end developer ensuring UI styling compliance.
user_goal: To validate that interactive elements use the correct forest green accent.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Interactive Buttons
narrative_steps.description: Developer Sam checks primary buttons for proper color implementation.
narrative_steps.action: Locate and inspect primary action buttons.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Buttons have background and border colors set to forest green (#228B22) as defined by CSS variables.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Hover Feedback
narrative_steps.description: Sam hovers over a button to observe hover effects.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a primary button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Button darkens slightly in shade, confirming hover state feedback.

narrative_steps.title: Validating Focus States
narrative_steps.description: He then focuses the button using keyboard navigation.
narrative_steps.action: Tab to focus on a primary button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Focused button receives a subtle glow effect matching the forest green tone.

requirement_tested: User interface controls for area selection and comparison management
user_persona: A civic engagement coordinator preparing a presentation.
user_goal: To quickly reset and start fresh with area selections.

narrative_steps.title: Making Several Selections
narrative_steps.description: Coordinator Lisa selects five neighborhoods for preliminary review.
narrative_steps.action: Click on five neighborhood boundaries.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Five neighborhoods are highlighted and added to the comparison manager list.

narrative_steps.title: Clearing Current Selection
narrative_steps.description: Deciding to change approach, Lisa clears all previous selections.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Clear All' button in the comparison manager panel.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All selections are removed, map returns to base unselected state, and comparison chips disappear.

requirement_tested: Configuration in package.json for concurrent frontend and backend development startup
user_persona: A DevOps engineer setting up a new developer workstation.
user_goal: To streamline local development by starting both services together.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Engineer Pat clones the repository and prepares dependencies.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` command in terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies install concurrently without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Pat starts the development environment for active coding.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend servers launch concurrently, making both accessible for development work.
